rules.natural: Either a doctor has access to patient records or a nurse has access to patient records.
Either the AI model diagnoses a ransomware infection or the response team confirms a ransomware outbreak.
Under the condition that the response team confirms a ransomware outbreak, the compliance officer does not grant an exemption.
If the dashboard monitors show access attempts, then the dashboard displays a warning about an unauthorized attempt.
If a nurse has access to patient records, then the organization is compliant with HIPAA.
Either the admin reviewed the logs, or, if it is not the case that a doctor having access to patient records implies HIPAA compliance for the organization, then the system triggers an alert.
Either the admin contacted support, or the admin did not review the logs.
Under the condition that the IDS generates a report on the incident, the security manager does not permit an override.
If it is not the case that a doctor having access to patient records implies HIPAA compliance for the organization, then the antivirus initiates a scan on the endpoints.
If it is not the case that a doctor having access to patient records implies HIPAA compliance for the organization, then the quarantine system isolates the device.
If it is not the case that the AI model diagnosing a ransomware infection implies that the compliance officer does not grant an exemption, then management issues a denial.
If it is not the case that the AI model diagnosing a ransomware infection implies that the compliance officer does not grant an exemption, then management does not issue a denial.

If it is not the case that either the CISO approves the emergency patch procedure or, if it is not the case that a doctor having access to patient records implies HIPAA compliance for the organization, then the system triggers an alert, then the IT department delays the response.

If it is not the case that the dashboard displaying a warning about an unauthorized attempt implies that either the SOC analyst escalates the alert or, whenever a device connection requires authorization, the IT department does not delay the response, then the NOC technician acknowledges the alert.

If it is not the case that the dashboard displaying a warning about an unauthorized attempt implies that either the SOC analyst escalates the alert or, whenever a device connection requires authorization, the IT department does not delay the response, then the NOC technician does not acknowledge the alert.
If it is not the case that the antivirus initiating a scan on the endpoints implies the system triggers an alert, then the antivirus does not update its signatures.
If it is not the case that the quarantine system isolating the device implies the system triggers an alert, then the security manager permits an override.
If it is not the case that the IDS detecting an anomaly in the clinic network implies it generates a report on the incident, then the compliance officer grants an exemption.

If it is not the case that the condition "it is not the case that the antivirus initiating a scan on the endpoints implies the system triggers an alert" implies the antivirus updates its signatures, then the IT staff rolls back the update.

If it is not the case that the condition "it is not the case that the antivirus initiating a scan on the endpoints implies the system triggers an alert" implies the antivirus updates its signatures, then the IT staff does not roll back the update.

The SOC analyst does not escalate the alert.
The system does not trigger an alert.
The admin did not contact support.

(A1 → G).natural: If a doctor has access to patient records, then the organization is compliant with HIPAA.

(A1 ∨ A2).natural: Either a doctor has access to patient records or a nurse has access to patient records.

(A11 → ¬A10).natural: Provided that the AI model diagnoses a ransomware infection, the compliance officer does not grant an exemption.

(A11 ∨ A12).natural: Either the AI model diagnoses a ransomware infection or the response team confirms a ransomware outbreak.

(A12 → ¬A10).natural: Under the condition that the response team confirms a ransomware outbreak, the compliance officer does not grant an exemption.

(A14 ∨ (¬(A1 → G) → A3)).natural: The CISO approves the emergency patch procedure, or, if it is not the case that a doctor having access to patient records implies HIPAA compliance for the organization, then the system triggers an alert.

(A16 → ¬A15).natural: Whenever a device connection requires authorization, the IT department does not delay the response.

(A17 ∨ (A16 → ¬A15)).natural: Either the SOC analyst escalates the alert, or, whenever a device connection requires authorization, the IT department does not delay the response.

(A18 → (A17 ∨ (A16 → ¬A15))).natural: If the dashboard monitors show access attempts, then either the SOC analyst escalates the alert or, provided that a device connection requires authorization, the IT department does not delay the response.

(A18 → A19).natural: If the dashboard monitors show access attempts, then the dashboard displays a warning about an unauthorized attempt.

(A19 → (A17 ∨ (A16 → ¬A15))).natural: Under the condition that the dashboard displays a warning about an unauthorized attempt, either the SOC analyst escalates the alert or, whenever a device connection requires authorization, the IT department does not delay the response.

(A2 → G).natural: If a nurse has access to patient records, then the organization is compliant with HIPAA.

(A21 → A3).natural: Provided that the antivirus initiates a scan on the endpoints, the system triggers an alert.

(A4 ∨ (¬(A1 → G) → A3)).natural: Either the admin reviewed the logs, or, if it is not the case that a doctor having access to patient records implies HIPAA compliance for the organization, then the system triggers an alert.

(A5 ∨ ¬A4).natural: Either the admin contacted support, or the admin did not review the logs.

(A6 → A3).natural: If the quarantine system isolates the device, then the system triggers an alert.

(A8 → A9).natural: If the IDS detects an anomaly in the clinic network, then the IDS generates a report on the incident.

(A8 → ¬A7).natural: Provided that the IDS detects an anomaly in the clinic network, the security manager does not permit an override.

(A9 → ¬A7).natural: Under the condition that the IDS generates a report on the incident, the security manager does not permit an override.

(¬(A1 → G) → A21).natural: If it is not the case that a doctor having access to patient records implies HIPAA compliance for the organization, then the antivirus initiates a scan on the endpoints.

(¬(A1 → G) → A3).natural: If it is not the case that a doctor having access to patient records implies HIPAA compliance for the organization, then the system triggers an alert.

(¬(A1 → G) → A6).natural: If it is not the case that a doctor having access to patient records implies HIPAA compliance for the organization, then the quarantine system isolates the device.

(¬(A11 → ¬A10) → A13).natural: If it is not the case that the AI model diagnosing a ransomware infection implies that the compliance officer does not grant an exemption, then management issues a denial.

(¬(A11 → ¬A10) → ¬A13).natural: If it is not the case that the AI model diagnosing a ransomware infection implies that the compliance officer does not grant an exemption, then management does not issue a denial.

(¬(A14 ∨ (¬(A1 → G) → A3)) → A15).natural: If it is not the case that either the CISO approves the emergency patch procedure or, if it is not the case that a doctor having access to patient records implies HIPAA compliance for the organization, then the system triggers an alert, then the IT department delays the response.

(¬(A19 → (A17 ∨ (A16 → ¬A15))) → A20).natural: If it is not the case that the dashboard displaying a warning about an unauthorized attempt implies that either the SOC analyst escalates the alert or, whenever a device connection requires authorization, the IT department does not delay the response, then the NOC technician acknowledges the alert.

(¬(A19 → (A17 ∨ (A16 → ¬A15))) → ¬A20).natural: If it is not the case that the dashboard displaying a warning about an unauthorized attempt implies that either the SOC analyst escalates the alert or, whenever a device connection requires authorization, the IT department does not delay the response, then the NOC technician does not acknowledge the alert.

(¬(A21 → A3) → A22).natural: If it is not the case that the antivirus initiating a scan on the endpoints implies the system triggers an alert, then the antivirus updates its signatures.

(¬(A21 → A3) → ¬A22).natural: If it is not the case that the antivirus initiating a scan on the endpoints implies the system triggers an alert, then the antivirus does not update its signatures.

(¬(A6 → A3) → A7).natural: If it is not the case that the quarantine system isolating the device implies the system triggers an alert, then the security manager permits an override.

(¬(A8 → A9) → A10).natural: If it is not the case that the IDS detecting an anomaly in the clinic network implies it generates a report on the incident, then the compliance officer grants an exemption.

(¬(¬(A21 → A3) → A22) → A23).natural: If it is not the case that the condition "it is not the case that the antivirus initiating a scan on the endpoints implies the system triggers an alert" implies the antivirus updates its signatures, then the IT staff rolls back the update.

(¬(¬(A21 → A3) → A22) → ¬A23).natural: If it is not the case that the condition "it is not the case that the antivirus initiating a scan on the endpoints implies the system triggers an alert" implies the antivirus updates its signatures, then the IT staff does not roll back the update.

A18.natural: The dashboard monitors show access attempts.

A8.natural: The IDS detects an anomaly in the clinic network.

G.natural: The organization is compliant with HIPAA.

¬A10.natural: The compliance officer does not grant an exemption.

¬A14.natural: The CISO does not approve the emergency patch procedure.

¬A15.natural: The IT department does not delay the response.

¬A17.natural: The SOC analyst does not escalate the alert.

¬A3.natural: The system does not trigger an alert.

¬A4.natural: The admin did not review the logs.

¬A5.natural: The admin did not contact support.

¬A7.natural: The security manager does not permit an override.
